trans-unit.source: Represents a thread-safe first in-first out (FIFO) collection.

<xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601> implements the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection%601> interface starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]; in previous versions of the .NET Framework, the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601> class did not implement this interface.
The type of the elements contained in the queue.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> class that contains elements copied from the specified collection
The collection whose elements are copied to the new <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
The collection argument is null.
Copies the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> elements to an existing one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at the specified array index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
index is less than zero.
index is equal to or greater than the length of the array -or- The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Gets the number of elements contained in the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.

For determining whether the collection contains any items, use of the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.IsEmpty%2A> property is recommended rather than retrieving the number of items from the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.Count%2A> property and comparing it to 0.
The number of elements contained in the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
Adds an object to the end of the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
The object to add to the end of the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
The value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for reference types.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
The enumeration represents a moment-in-time snapshot of the contents of the queue.
It does not reflect any updates to the collection after <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.GetEnumerator%2A> was called.
The enumerator is safe to use concurrently with reads from and writes to the queue.
The enumerator returns the collection elements in the order in which they were added, which is FIFO order (first-in, first-out).
An enumerator for the contents of the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> is empty.

For determining whether the collection contains any items, use of this property is recommended rather than retrieving the number of items from the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.Count%2A> property and comparing it to 0.

However, as this collection is intended to be accessed concurrently, it may be the case that another thread will modify the collection after <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.IsEmpty%2A> returns, thus invalidating the result.
true if the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> is empty; otherwise, false.
Copies the elements stored in the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> to a new array.
A new array containing a snapshot of elements copied from the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>.
Tries to remove and return the object at the beginning of the concurrent queue.
<xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601> handles all synchronization internally.
If two threads call <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.TryDequeue%2A> at precisely the same moment, neither operation is blocked.
When a conflict is detected between two threads, one thread has to try again to retrieve the next element, and the synchronization is handled internally.
<xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.TryDequeue%2A> tries to remove an element from the queue.
If the method is successful, the item is removed and the method returns `true`; otherwise, it returns `false`.
That happens atomically with respect to other operations on the queue.

If the queue was populated with code such as `q.Enqueue("a"); q.Enqueue("b"); q.Enqueue("c");` and two threads concurrently try to dequeue an element, one thread will dequeue `a` and the other thread will dequeue `b`.
Both calls to <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601.TryDequeue%2A> will return `true`, because they were both able to dequeue an element.
If each thread goes back to dequeue an additional element, one of the threads will dequeue `c` and return `true`, whereas the other thread will find the queue empty and will return `false`.
When this method returns, if the operation was successful, result contains the object removed.
If no object was available to be removed, the value is unspecified.
`true` if an element was removed and returned from the beginning of the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> successfully; otherwise, `false`.
Tries to return an object from the beginning of the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref> without removing it.
When this method returns, result contains an object from the beginning of the or an unspecified value if the operation failed.
`true` if an object was returned successfully; otherwise, `false`.
Attempts to add an object to the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.IProducerConsumerCollection`1"></xref>.
For <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601>, this operation will always add the object to the end of the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601> and return true.
The object to add to the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.IProducerConsumerCollection`1"></xref>.
The value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) for reference types.
true if the object was added successfully; otherwise, false.
Attempts to remove and return an object from the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.IProducerConsumerCollection`1"></xref>.
For <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601>, this operation will attempt to remove the object from the beginning of the <xref:System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue%601>.
When this method returns, if the operation was successful, item contains the object removed.
If no object was available to be removed, the value is unspecified.
true if an element was removed and returned succesfully; otherwise, false.
Copies the elements of the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> to an <xref href="System.Array"></xref>, starting at a particular <xref href="System.Array"></xref> index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the elements copied from the <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentBag`1"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
array is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or- array does not have zero-based indexing.
-or- index is equal to or greater than the length of the array -or- The number of elements in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
-or- The type of the source cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination array.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> is synchronized with the SyncRoot.
true if access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> is synchronized with the SyncRoot; otherwise, false.
For <xref href="System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentQueue`1"></xref>, this property always returns false.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
This property is not supported.
Returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The SyncRoot property is not supported.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
